Author: Lumbi#8378
Content:
I also recommend Linux users to always :
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade -y before rebuilding to 0.3.3b :
```#!/bin/bash
cd ~/komodo
git pull --rebase
make clean
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/StakedChain/pos64staker/blob/master/kmdrpc.py
@Regnar  This is something to get you started

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
There is no doubt a better way to handle that, but it works and it easy to follow. I was using it yesterday. Simply add a new function by copy paste for each RPC you need to use.. then to use it:
`getpubkey_result = kmdrpc.getpubkey_rpc('MGNX')`
for example... which will give you a string containing the -pubkey that is set.
I added a `setpubkey` aswell... so you dont have to restart deamon to set it.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Kyung-Nam Park this is because your node was on a fork, you may need to resync

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @ca333 do you know if that build above has the new maxreorg thing?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ah nope, it never made it to master. That was the remedy for this problem.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Kyung-Nam Park you can try `invalidateblock 052bd85cb70e1ec2184f7e68dd3f21b6bee5fd0d5dbd3c58df0080d1babc0f39` as soon as you start the node. Wait a moment, then do `reconsiderblock 052bd85cb70e1ec2184f7e68dd3f21b6bee5fd0d5dbd3c58df0080d1babc0f39`. Not sure this will work, but it's worth a try

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if that doesn't work, you can either resync or build from this branch https://github.com/jl777/komodo/commits/beta then start with node with `./komodod -maxreorg=175`

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
```sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev m4 g++-multilib autoconf libtool ncurses-dev unzip git python python-zmq zlib1g-dev wget libcurl3-gnutls-dev bsdmainutils automake

After installing dependencies clone the Komodo repository:
cd
git clone https://github.com/komodoplatform/komodo
cd komodo

After moving to the new Komodo directory execute the following commands to build Komodo:
./zcutil/fetch-params.sh
./zcutil/build.sh```

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: You need to compile komodo first and then check for that file @SlhCn
